description: Fix trend calculations, units, and visual indicators for non-strength exercise types (pace, duration, distance, heart rate)

userStories.title: Add UNITS_MAP and COLUMN_LABELS constants
userStories.description: As a developer, I need centralized constants for data type units and column labels so all components use consistent values.
acceptanceCriteria: Add UNITS_MAP to app/constants/ui.constants.ts mapping CHART_DATA_TYPE to unit strings
Units: volume='kg', weight='kg', reps='', duration='sec', distance='km', pace='min/km', heartRate='bpm'
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. UNITS_MAP and COLUMN_LABELS added to ui.constants.ts with import from ChartTypes. Already exported via barrel.

userStories.title: Create FormatUtils with duration and pace formatters
userStories.description: As a developer, I need centralized formatting utilities so duration displays as '1h 30m' and pace as '5:30'.
acceptanceCriteria: formatDuration(seconds: number): string - returns '30s', '5m 30s', or '1h 30m' format
formatValue(value: number, dataType: CHART_DATA_TYPE): string - dispatcher applying correct formatter
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. FormatUtils class with formatDuration, formatPace, and formatValue methods. Exported via barrel at @app/utils.

userStories.title: Add FormatUtils unit tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I need tests for FormatUtils to ensure formatting edge cases are handled correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Test formatValue dispatches correctly for each CHART_DATA_TYPE
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Created FormatUtils.test.ts with 28 tests covering: formatDuration (0, 30, 60, 90, 3600, 3661, 5400, negative), formatPace (0, 4.25, 5.0, 5.5, 10.75, negative), and formatValue for all CHART_DATA_TYPEs (DURATION, PACE, REPS, VOLUME, WEIGHT, DISTANCE, HEART_RATE).

userStories.title: Add isLowerBetter helper function
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a helper to determine if a data type uses inverted logic (lower values = improvement).
acceptanceCriteria: Add isLowerBetter(dataType: CHART_DATA_TYPE): boolean to FormatUtils.ts
Returns false for all other types
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Added isLowerBetter static method to FormatUtils class. Returns true for PACE type only, false for all others. Added 7 unit tests covering all CHART_DATA_TYPE values.

userStories.title: Fix TrendCalculator inverted logic for pace
userStories.description: As a user tracking pace, I want green trend when pace decreases (faster) so indicators accurately reflect improvement.
acceptanceCriteria: TrendCalculator.getTrendIndicators() accepts optional dataType: CHART_DATA_TYPE parameter
For pace: negative slope returns 'Improving' with green color
For pace: positive slope returns 'Declining' with red color
Other data types maintain current behavior
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Added optional dataType parameter to getTrendIndicators(). Added IMPROVING and DECLINING status constants to TRENDS_UI. For pace, negative slope returns Improving (green), positive slope returns Declining (red). Existing behavior preserved for other types.

userStories.title: Add TrendCalculator tests for pace inversion
userStories.description: As a developer, I need tests confirming TrendCalculator handles pace correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Add test: pace with negative slope returns Improving/green
Add test: pace with positive slope returns Declining/red
Add test: volume with positive slope still returns Increasing/green
Add test: missing dataType uses default behavior
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Added 7 tests in dataType parameter for inverted logic describe block: pace negative slope = Improving/green, pace positive slope = Declining/red, volume positive slope = Increasing/green, default behavior without dataType, stable pace within threshold, weight maintains default, heart rate maintains default. All 600 tests pass.

userStories.title: Fix StatsBox dynamic units and title
userStories.description: As a user viewing pace statistics, I want to see 'min/km' units and 'Pace Statistics' title instead of hardcoded 'kg' and 'Volume Statistics'.
acceptanceCriteria: Average, max, min values display unit from UNITS_MAP
Title changes dynamically: 'Volume Statistics', 'Pace Statistics', etc.
Duration values use formatDuration from FormatUtils
Pace values use formatPace from FormatUtils
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. StatsBox.render() now accepts optional dataType parameter (defaults to VOLUME). Title dynamically generated from COLUMN_LABELS (e.g., 'Pace Statistics'). Added formatStatValue() for avg/max/min using formatDuration/formatPace/units. Updated calculateRecentTrend() with dataType for inverted color logic and dynamic units.

userStories.title: Fix StatsBox trend color inversion for pace
userStories.description: As a user tracking pace, I want red trend when pace increases (slower) and green when it decreases (faster).
acceptanceCriteria: Use isLowerBetter helper to determine color logic
For pace: positive change = red, negative change = green
Recent trend displays correct unit from UNITS_MAP
userStories.notes: Implemented as part of US-007 (2026-02-03). calculateRecentTrend() now accepts dataType, uses FormatUtils.isLowerBetter() for inverted color logic, and UNITS_MAP for dynamic units.

userStories.title: Fix TrendHeader direction logic for pace
userStories.description: As a user, I want the trend arrow to show improvement correctly for pace (down arrow when pace increases = declining).
acceptanceCriteria: TrendHeader.render() accepts optional dataType: CHART_DATA_TYPE parameter
For pace: negative percent = 'up' arrow (improving), positive = 'down' arrow (declining)
Arrow color matches trend direction (green=improving, red=declining)
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Added optional dataType parameter to TrendHeader.render(). Uses FormatUtils.isLowerBetter() to determine if trend logic should be inverted. For pace: negative % shows UP arrow (improving/faster), positive % shows DOWN arrow (declining/slower). Non-pace types maintain original behavior. CSS classes trend-up/trend-down handle coloring.

userStories.title: Extend MobileTable column labels
userStories.description: As a user on mobile, I want column headers to show correct labels for all data types, not just volume/weight/reps.
acceptanceCriteria: Replace ternary chain with COLUMN_LABELS[chartType] lookup
Fallback to chartType string if not in map
userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Replaced ternary chain with COLUMN_LABELS[chartType] lookup in MobileTable.ts. Fallback to chartType string if not in map. Now displays correct labels for all data types: 'Duration', 'Distance (km)', 'Pace (min/km)', 'Heart Rate (bpm)' in addition to existing volume/weight/reps.

userStories.title: Propagate dataType through EmbeddedChartView

userStories.notes: Implemented 2026-02-03. Modified EmbeddedChartView.ts to pass resolvedType/dataType to: TrendCalculator.getTrendIndicators() (line 123), TrendHeader.render() (line 280), and StatsBox.render() (line 318). All components now receive the correct dataType for type-specific logic (e.g., pace inversion).
